summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing a press conference held at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion on January 27, 2020. The emails show FBI personnel seeking information about the press conference, noting that victims were not notified and were irate, and requesting guidance on what to convey to victims.

persons.name: Aaron Katersky
persons.context: His Twitter post containing a photo is linked in the email as a source of information about the press conference at Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20
persons.context: The sender of the initial email inquiry about the press conference at Epstein's mansion, identifying as part of the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in the FBI New York office.

events.title: Press Conference at Epstein's Mansion
events.description: A press conference was held at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion, generating media inquiries and causing distress among victims who were not notified about it.

keyFacts: A press conference was held at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion on January 27, 2020.
The FBI's media affairs department and victim specialists were fielding questions and calls about the press conference.
Victims of Epstein were reportedly irate because they were not notified about the press conference.
FBI personnel were seeking information and guidance on what to convey to the victims regarding the press conference.
The email references the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) in the New York office.
